description: pallette is predominanty beige, grey, white and green; two white cranes on panel 2 with several other birds and ducks; bamboo on L; painting on back of screen also
inscription: Right: {Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu}; Left: {Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu} (Coloured bird and flower painted by Shugetsu (Yasunobu authenticates painting as to be by Shugetsu, immediately prior to his own signature.) xx xx bird and flower painted by shugetsu)
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair
text: On the right screen, a horned owl in a pine tree watches hawks chase herons at the edge of a lotus pond. On the left screen, cranes, ducks, and other birds are dispersed among plum, bamboo, reed, and hibiscus. An inscription by the painter Kanō Yasunobu (1613–1685) assigns this pair to Shūgetsu Tōkan; on the other side is a painting of pine trees on gold leaf by Yasunobu. (2013.29.20.1-.2)
title: Birds in Landscape [left of a pair]
